intro: Gothofreda glomerata, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in late summer, producing violet or blue flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Gothofreda glomerata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in well-drained, sunny environments.
